articles.headline: Showdown Nears on Debt as Obama Warns of ‘Crisis’
articles.snippet: President Obama urged “a balanced approach” that would include higher tax revenues as well as cuts. Speaker John A. Boehner accused Mr. Obama of asking for “a blank check.”
articles.abstract: President Obama urged “a balanced approach” that would include higher tax revenues as well as cuts. Speaker John A. Boehner accused Mr. Obama of asking for “a blank check.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Democratic-led Senate and Republican-led House on Monday barreled toward a showdown on competing plans to cut spending and raise the debt limit as a resolution to the intensifying crisis remained farther from sight just one week before a possible federal default.
articles.byline: By Carl Hulse and Jackie Calmes

articles.headline: Manufactured Goods Lead Surge in Indian Exports
articles.snippet: High-value products like industrial machinery, automobiles and car parts are leading the way in an escalation of exports.
articles.abstract: High-value products like industrial machinery, automobiles and car parts are leading the way in an escalation of exports.
articles.lead_paragraph: PUNE, India — When Ranjit Date returned to India 20 years ago after earning a doctorate in robotics from an American university, he hoped to help automate factory assembly lines in his home country.

articles.headline: A Bonanza for Airlines as Taxes End
articles.snippet: As various federal taxes expired, most airlines lifted prices by an amount equal to the customer’s savings.
articles.abstract: As various federal taxes expired, most airlines lifted prices by an amount equal to the customer’s savings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Let’s talk about taxes. Wait a second, come back here! I mean airfare taxes.

articles.headline: Unsettling Wariness in Norway, Where Police Are Rarely Armed
articles.snippet: After Friday’s deadly attacks in Norway, questions are growing about whether the police are equipped to deal with violent crime.
articles.abstract: After Friday’s deadly attacks in Norway, questions are growing about whether the police are equipped to deal with violent crime.
articles.lead_paragraph: OSLO — When a man dressed in a police uniform began slaughtering young people at a Norwegian summer camp last week, one of the first to be killed was a real police officer named Trond Berntsen, who for years had worked in security at the camp.

articles.headline: The Help-Wanted Sign Comes With a Frustrating Asterisk
articles.snippet: Many employers consider or strongly prefer only people who are employed or recently laid off.
articles.abstract: Many employers consider or strongly prefer only people who are employed or recently laid off.

articles.headline: Lawsuit Says Drugs Were Wasted to Buoy Profit
articles.snippet: DaVita is accused of using large vials of dialysis medicine knowing that Medicare would pay for the unused portion.
articles.abstract: DaVita is accused of using large vials of dialysis medicine knowing that Medicare would pay for the unused portion.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the nation’s largest providers of kidney dialysis deliberately wasted medicine in order to reap hundreds of millions of dollars in extra payments from Medicare, a former clinic nurse and a doctor are charging in a whistle-blower lawsuit.

articles.headline: Murdoch Veterans Portray an Engaged Boss
articles.snippet: While seemingly distant and unfocused during the hacking hearings, Rupert Murdoch has never been a distant boss.
articles.abstract: While seemingly distant and unfocused during the hacking hearings, Rupert Murdoch has never been a distant boss.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — It was the political scoop of the year, a damning, serialized exposé in The Daily Telegraph about how British politicians were abusing their parliamentary expense accounts to pay for things like moat-cleaning and wisteria-trimming.
articles.byline: By Sarah Lyall and Graham Bowley

articles.headline: Recession Study Finds Hispanics Hit the Hardest
articles.snippet: The study with data collected by the Census Bureau found that the median wealth of Hispanic households fell by 66 percent from 2005 to 2009.
articles.abstract: The study with data collected by the Census Bureau found that the median wealth of Hispanic households fell by 66 percent from 2005 to 2009.
articles.lead_paragraph: WOODBRIDGE, Va. — Hispanic families accounted for the largest single decline in wealth of any ethnic and racial group in the country during the recession, according to a study published Tuesday by the Pew Research Center.

articles.headline: For Suspected Hackers, a Sense of Social Protest
articles.snippet: Some of the people suspected of hacking PayPal said they had participated in an online protest.
articles.abstract: Some of the people suspected of hacking PayPal said they had participated in an online protest.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The F.B.I.’s arrests of 14 people last week were the most ambitious crackdown yet on a loose-knit group of hackers called Anonymous that has attacked a string of government agencies and private companies over the last eight months.
